spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall zoning (living left, dining center, bedrooms to the right) is roughly similar, but several key spatial features from the 2D plan are not represented correctly. Balconies shown on the 2D plan are not modeled as exterior balcony spaces in the 3D render (replaced by windows/exterior wall). Entry/foyer location and circulation do not match the 2D layout (2D entry at left into a foyer; 3D shows a different entry/vestibule placement and path). Multiple toilet/bathroom locations and door orientations do not align with the 2D plan, and room size relationships (living vs dining and bedroom wing proportions) appear distorted.

structural_fidelity.notes: Wall thickness looks consistent, but adjacency and program fidelity diverge from the 2D plan: balconies are missing, and service spaces (utility + servant room) are not clearly present as in the 2D. Toilet blocks are simplified/rearranged relative to the 2D plan (count and placement mismatch). Some internal partitions and door openings appear reinterpreted, creating different corridor/room connections than the plan.

furniture_mapping.notes: Living room seating group and central dining table are broadly consistent with the plan intent, but the exact furniture count/placement (especially living seating layout and bedroom furniture positioning) does not match the 2D plan closely. Scale feels generally plausible, though some rooms appear furnished more spaciously than their 2D proportions suggest.

aesthetic_quality.notes: Clean, visually appealing isometric-style render with good lighting and legible room separation. However, it reads more like a perspective/isometric hybrid than a strict orthographic/isometric technical depiction. Geometry is mostly clean with no major artifacts, but the camera and window/door modeling choices emphasize aesthetics over plan-accurate fidelity.

detected_errors.description: Missing both balconies shown on the 2D plan (living balcony and master bedroom balcony); 3D replaces these with exterior walls/windows rather than balcony areas.
Utility area and servant room (service zone near kitchen in 2D) are missing or not clearly modeled as distinct rooms in the 3D render.
Main entry/foyer placement and resulting circulation path differ from the 2D plan (2D entry at left into defined foyer; 3D shows a different entry lobby arrangement).

Bathroom/toilet program is not faithfully preserved: the 2D plan indicates more/to differently arranged toilets (including master suite toilets and common/powder toilets) than what is clearly present in 3D.
Several bathroom/toilet locations appear shifted relative to the bedroom wing compared to the 2D plan (toilet blocks not matching the plan’s placements).
Multiple internal door orientations/openings (notably around the central hall and bathrooms) do not match the 2D plan’s swing directions and entry points.
Window placement is inconsistent with the 2D plan: the 3D model adds/relocates large windows and omits balcony door openings implied by the plan.
Proportion distortion: relative sizes/shape of living-dining core and the bedroom wing do not appear to preserve the 2D plan’s room proportions and wall spans.
Hallucinated exterior fenestration: additional/oversized windows appear on façades where the 2D plan does not indicate corresponding openings.
